description: This article was the final output of our Advanced Algorithms and Data Structures class for our M.S. Computer Science course (CSCI 201). The task was to research on how one algorithm or data structure works and how it's applied onto real world problems. My article deals with the k-means clustering algorithm and how it can be used to help improve healthcare facility infrastructure. I break the algorithm down step-by-step then demonstrate how it is applied to identify potential areas for health facility construction.
title: Using K-means clustering: performing site selection to identify build-able areas for health centers (RHUs)

description: This article was the final output of our Programming Languages and Paradigms class for my M.S. Computer Science course (CSCI 202). The task was to choose one programming language and research about it. I chose the Rust programming language because I personally never used it in the academic nor professional setting. The article contains a compact yet detailed discussion of Rust, its unique features,advantages, disadvantages, and usecases in the industry.
title: Rust Programming: A Safe, Fast, and Versatile Choice

authors: Martina Therese R. Reyes, Dr. Ma. Regina Justina E. Estuar, Ph. D., Jann Railey E. Montalan, M.S.
description: The 7th Graduate Research Festival is a celebration of all graduate students who present their completed their masteral or doctorate studies.
title: I-HOPE: DEVELOPMENT OF AN INTELLIGENT HEALTH FACILITY OPTIMIZER AND RECOMMENDER SYSTEM FOR OPTIMAL PLACEMENT OF RURAL HEALTH UNITS IN A REGION

authors: Martina Therese R. Reyes, Dr. Ma. Regina Justina E. Estuar, Ph. D., Jann Railey E. Montalan, M.S.
description: The 10th International Conference on Public Health - ICOPH 2024 was held in Bangkok, Thailand on the 15-16th of August 2024. This conference gave me the platform to share my research by presenting in a public forum. I showcased my work on optimizing health facility locations in the Philippines using neural networks. Though it was mainly a proof of concept, it can adapt and be flexible depending on the location it will be applied on. I was very proud to answer during the Q&A portion because the audience and panel seemed interested in the study. Overall, it was an engaging experience because I was able to listen to other students, health experts and/or policy makers and doctors (to name a few!) present their work on how they solve public health issues in their country.
title: Back Propagation and Recurrent Neural Networks for Optimal Location of Rural Health Unit Facilities in the Philippines

authors: Martina Therese R. Reyes, Dr. Ma. Regina Justina E. Estuar, Ph. D., Jann Railey E. Montalan, M.S.
title: Providing Universal Health Care Access to Filipinos Region-wide using Back Propagation and Recurrent Neural Networks for Finding Optimal Locations to Place Rural Health Unit Facilities in the Philippines
